quiz.question: What is the national anthem of the United States?
Which country's national motto appears on its coat of arms as 'Plus Ultra'?
Which country's national anthem includes stanzas borrowed from a 19th-century independence song written by an exile?
Which country's national anthem is titled 'Lupang Hinirang'?
In which year did the United States officially adopt 'The Star-Spangled Banner' as its national anthem?
Which country revised its anthem in 1994 to remove references to a previous political system while keeping the melody?
Which nation's official motto is 'Satyameva Jayate', meaning 'Truth alone triumphs'?
Which country's national anthem opens with words meaning 'Arise, descendants of' in its official language?
Which national anthem melody was used as the basis for the Prussian royal anthem 'Heil dir im Siegerkranz'?
What is the traditional royal anthem of the United Kingdom?
Which country's national motto 'Dieu et mon droit' uses a French phrase despite an English-speaking nation?
Which national anthem was composed by a musician who later became famous as a bandleader for a state's official choir?
Which country's current national anthem melody was composed by Joseph Haydn?
Which country's anthem melody was originally written as an emperor's hymn titled 'Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser'?
Which country's national motto is a Latin phrase once used as a Roman imperial slogan and later adopted by the modern state?
